intro: Corallocarpus harmsii, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by elongated, fleshy fruits. Its botanical features include a complex root system and the presence of calcium oxalate crystals in its tissues. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
